sentences.english: Select the characters to use in brute-force cracking. Must be one of
sentences.chinese: 選擇字符使用蠻力破解。

sentences.english: Automated tests, on the other hand, take a brute-force approach.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，自動化測試採取一種蠻力的方法。

sentences.english: They used brute-force computation and heuristics for their solutions.
sentences.chinese: 他們用蠻力測試計算和啓發法尋找解決方案。

sentences.english: He was not especially well coordinated, but he had a lot of raw power.
sentences.chinese: 他的動作並不十分協調，但卻有着一股子蠻力。

sentences.english: The counter-protest strategy of the government has been limited to gas, batons and brute force.
sentences.chinese: 政府的反抗議戰略一直僅限於氣，警棍和蠻力。

definition: indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to force someone to do something
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
